docs.title: Welcome to The Cornell Store Knowledge Hub
docs.text: This is the official documentation hub for everything regarding the Digital Communications System.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Retail Recap is our weekly internal newsletter designed to keep Cornell Retail Services staff informed and connected. Hosted on our SharePoint site and shared via email, it includes key updates such as:

  • Shoutouts recognizing team contributions
  • Announcements on upcoming events or changes
  • Resources for staff support and reference
  • Spotlights highlighting individual team members
  • …and more

Retail Recap ensures everyone stays in the loop on what’s happening across our stores each week.

Retail Recap Preview

docs.title: Creating Retail Recaps
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Weekly Retail Recap Directory

  2. Select any news post you want. Ideally, select the most recent one.

  3. Once opened, click + New > Copy of this news post.
  4. Update the Title.
  5. People Profiles: Add you and collaborators profiles.
  6. What's New: Update with a Table of Contents of finished newsletter.
  7. Shoutouts: Check any recent shoutouts from the Shoutouts list or ask around for Shoutouts.
  8. Upcoming Events: For this section, you can pull the information from the (Events database)[https://cornellprod.sharepoint.com/sites/TheCornellStore/_layouts/15/Events.aspx].
  9. Shoutouts: Feel free to edit or leave as is.

  10. Student/Staff Spotlight:

    Preparing the Spotlights

    The staff spotlight is meant to highlight any staff member at the store. Here's what you'll need:

    • A Staff Member
    • A picture of them
    • Interview Questions Answered

    Need help drafting the interview questions? Below are a couple suggestions of questions. Feel free to add, remove, or modify the questions.

    • What is your title?
    • How long have you been with Cornell Retail Services?
    • What is your job?
    • What is your favorite item in store?
    • What is your favorite restaurant in Ithaca?
    • Tell us something most people don't know about you?

  11. For the rest of the sections: Feel free to leave, add, or remove them.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
The Employee Records System is the central tool used by Cornell Retail Services to keep track of employee information. It covers everything from when someone joins the team to when they leave.

Using this system helps us:

  • Keep an up-to-date list of everyone working across our stores.
  • Make sure our email lists (listservs) are accurate.
  • Maintain clear records of employee details — including students.
  • Streamline our hiring and exit processes.
  • Support other tools that rely on this information, like:
    • Staff availability schedules
    • Radio assignments

View Employee Records System

docs.title: Add an Employee
docs.text:
Requirements:

This step is to be completed when the following requirements have been met:

  • The employee has been hired by the University and a NetID has been created.
  • If this is a returning employee, they have left their role at The Cornell Store for more than 6 months (otherwise, please reactivate them).
  1. Navigate to the Employee Records System.
  2. Click + New Employee
  3. Fill out all the fields. Unsure how to fill them out? Refer to this table.
  4. Click Save.
Adding an Employee will:
  • Send the employee, their supervisor, and the creator an onboarding email (Ready for Day One email).
  • Add them to the corresponding listserv (Part-time, Full-time, or Student) depending on employment type.
  • If applicable, will add them to their corresponding Team on Microsoft Teams.

docs.title: Remove an Employee
docs.text:
Warning:

Please refrain from deleting the record. To identify if you are deleting instead of removing check if you are clicking a button that says delete.

  1. Navigate to the Employee Records System.
  2. Find the employee you would like to remove from the database.
  3. Click on the red minus button left of their name.

When clicked, the employee's status will change to Inactive.

Removing an Employee will:
  • Send the the supervisor, and the modifier an off-boarding email (Off-boarding Tasks email).
  • Remove them to the corresponding listserv (Part-time, Full-time, or Student) depending on employment type.
  • If the employee is a supervisor, it will send The Cornell Store and the modifier of the record an email reporting employees that need a supervisor update. Note: While adding the employee adds them to Teams (if applicable), removing them will not automatically revoke their access to Teams. They must be removed from Teams manually.

docs.title: Reactivate an Employee
docs.text:
Requirements :

You may only reactivate an employee if the following requirements are met:

  • The employee has been previously registered in the system.
  • The employee was deactivated for no more than 6 months (1)
  1. If you cannot find them in the system, that means the employee has been deactivated and needs new registration.

Steps:

  1. Navigate to the Employee Records System.
  2. Ensure you are viewing the Inactive view (check the top right corner of the database).
  3. Find the employee you would like to reactivate from the database.
  4. Click on the green check button left of their name.

When clicked, the employee's status will change to Active.

Reactivating an Employee will:
  • Send the employee, their supervisor, and the creator an onboarding email (Ready for Day One email).
  • Add them to the corresponding listserv (Part-time, Full-time, or Student) depending on employment type.
  • If applicable, will add them to their corresponding Team on Microsoft Teams.

docs.title: Modify an Employee's details.
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Employee Records System.
  2. Find the employee you would like to edit from the database.
  3. Click on the gray pencil button left of their name.

When clicked, the employee's details will appear. You will be able to modify any of the fields created.

Need to edit everyone's details at once?

Say you added a new column, or need to change everyone's lockers to 'Empty.' Doing so is super simple.

  1. On the top of the administrative list, click Edit in Grid View.
  2. Navigate to the column you'd like to edit.
  3. Make your edits.
  4. On the bottom right corner of the cell, you will see a white square appear. Click and drag that to the cells you'd like to autofill.

docs.title: View or Download Records as a spreadsheet
docs.text:
While the system is designed to look interactive, it also functions as a standard CSV (spreadsheet) file. This means you can download the records and edit them on Excel, Numbers, or any spreadsheet-based platform.

Make sure you are on the Administrative View version of the system.

  1. Navigate to the Employee Records System.
  2. Make sure you are on the Administrative View version of the system.
  3. Filter or Sort the database as you desire (filter by Active employees, sort by Name, etc.)
  4. Above the database, find the Export button in the menu bar.
  5. Click it and select Export to CSV.

Warning of Employee Records Download

Please note: while there is nothing inherently sensitive regarding employee records, please exercise caution when downloading CSV versions of the database.

docs.title: Notification Emails
docs.text:
Using this system may send notification emails to particular employees or the system inbox.

Day One Email

Email Preview

This email gets sent if any of the following conditions are met:

  • Employee is set to Active.
  • Employee is Reactivated.

More information:

  • It is sent to the new Employee, their Supervisor, and the person who created modified/created the record.
  • It is sent from the SCL-CBS-YODECK-EMP email disguised as custorestaff@cornell.edu.

Day One Email Preview

Code

If you need help modifying or adding more details to this template, please copy and paste it into an AI tool like ChatGPT and ask for modifications to be made.

Off-Boarding Email

Email Preview

This email gets sent if any of the following conditions are met:

  • Employee is set to Inactive.

More information:

  • It is sent to the Supervisor and the person who created modified/created the record.
  • It is sent from the SCL-CBS-YODECK-EMP email disguised as custorestaff@cornell.edu.

Off-Boarding Email Preview

Code

If you need help modifying or adding more details to this template, please copy and paste it into an AI tool like ChatGPT and ask for modifications to be made.

Off-Boarding Email.html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
  <meta charset="UTF-8">
  <title>Employee Removal Notification</title>
  <style>
    body {
      font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
      background-color: #F7F7F7;
      margin: 0;
      padding: 0;
    }
    .container {
      max-width: 600px;
      margin: 20px auto;
      background: #ffffff;
      padding: 20px;
      border-radius: 8px;
      box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
    }
    .header {
      background-color: #B31B1B;
      color: #ffffff;
      text-align: center;
      padding: 15px;
      border-radius: 8px 8px 0 0;
      font-size: 20px;
    }
    .content {
      padding: 20px;
      color: #333333;
      font-size: 15px;
    }
    .ticket-info {
      background-color: #f9f9f9;
      padding: 15px;
      border-left: 4px solid #222222;
      margin: 20px 0;
      border-radius: 5px;
    }
    .footer {
      text-align: center;
      font-size: 12px;
      color: #888888;
      padding: 10px;
      margin-top: 20px;
    }
    .button {
      display: inline-block;
      background-color: #B31B1B;
      color: #ffffff;
      padding: 10px 15px;
      text-decoration: none;
      border-radius: 5px;
      margin-top: 10px;
    }
    .button:hover {
      background-color: #A11A1A;
    }
  </style>
</head>
<body>

  <div class="container">
    <div class="header">
      Employee Removal Notification
    </div>
    <div class="content">
      <p>Hello <strong>@{first(split(outputs('Get_record_that_has_been_modified')?['body/Supervisor/DisplayName'], ' '))}</strong>,</p>


      <p><strong>Please remove the following employee from Microsoft Teams and any other relevant systems:</strong></p>

      <div class="ticket-info">
        <p><strong>Employee Name: </strong>@{outputs('Get_record_that_has_been_modified')?['body/Employee/DisplayName']}</p>
        <p><strong>Employee Email:</strong> @{outputs('Get_record_that_has_been_modified')?['body/Employee/Email']}</p>
        <p><strong>Microsoft Team:</strong> @{outputs('Get_record_that_has_been_modified')?['body/MSTeams/Value']}</p>
        <p><strong>Locker:</strong> @{outputs('Get_record_that_has_been_modified')?['body/Locker']}</p>
      </div>

      <p>If you need guidance, you can follow Microsoft’s official instructions here:</p>
      <p>
        <a href="https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/remove-someone-from-a-team-in-microsoft-teams-91610d8b-c182-4cab-8f31-1ed8d3d316ee" target="_blank">
          Remove Someone from a Team in Microsoft Teams
        </a>
      </p>

      <p>If you have any questions or need additional support, please reply to this email.</p>

    </div>
    <div class="footer">
      Cornell University | Cornell Retail Services System
    </div>
  </div>

</body>
</html>

Supervisor Removal Email

Email Preview

This email gets sent if all of the following conditions are met:

  • An Employee is Inactivated.
  • The Employee supervised at least one other employee.

More information:

  • It is sent to the custorestaff inbox and the person who created modified/created the record.
  • It is sent from the SCL-CBS-YODECK-EMP email disguised as custorestaff@cornell.edu.

docs.title: Groups
docs.text:
Depending on the Status of the Employee, Listserv selected, and Advanced SharePoint Access check, they will be added/removed from the following groups:

Group Status Listserv Advanced SharePoint Access Adds to Full-time Active Full-time Part-time Active Part-time Student Active Student Advanced SharePoint Active Yes Removes from Full-time Inactive Full-time Part-time Inactive Part-time Student Inactive Student Advanced SharePoint Inactive No Note: blank columns mean that the value in the column is irrelevant.

docs.title: Other Effects
docs.text:
Staff Availability

Whenever staff create new availability for themselves, they look up their name using a dropdown. The dropdown values are pulled directly from the Employee Record System. Therefore, if the employee is not registered in the ERS, they will not be able to add their availability.

Radio Assignments

Whenever radios get assigned to staff, the Radio Database uses an Employee Name dropdown to link the employee to the radio. The dropdown values from Employee Name are pulled directly from the Employee Record System. Therefore, if the employee is not registered in the ERS, they will not be found when assigning a radio.

docs.text:
The information in this section can be accessed or modified from the List Settings, available below.

View List Settings

docs.title: Views
docs.text:
In SharePoint Lists, views are customized ways of displaying list data — they let you filter, sort, or group items to focus on specific information. Each view can show different columns, layouts, or criteria depending on the user’s needs.

Below is a list of all current views in the Employee Records System.

View Purpose Access JSON Comments Administrative View Gives the user unfilter and unsorted access to all records in the database as well as all columns. View No Availability View Gives the user a department-grouped view of Active Employees to see their Last & Return Days, as well as direct access to their availability. View No This view is specifically useful for the Staff Availability System. All Employees Gives the user a list of all currently active employees in Cornell Retail Services. View No Inactive Gives the user a list of all inactive employees in Cornell Retail Services. View No Only inactive employees that have been placed inactive in the last 6 months (they get deleted afterwards).

Want to Create Your Own View?

Lists also lets you create your own view that can be easily accessible by other viewers of the list. You can customize the columns, placement, even the design of it (like how Announcements goes from spreadsheet to banners!).

View more here.

docs.title: Column Details
docs.text:
Note:

The Required column described below is different than what the list settings will show on SharePoint. This is intentional to provide the reader of this document better guidance on using the system.

Name Internal Name Type Required Description Comments Preferred Name Title Single line of text Yes Employee's preferred name or full name. Employee Title Person or Group Yes Employee Microsoft Profile. Only searchable if NetID has been activated. Key Title Number Yes Employee or Student ID PCI Required Title Yes/No No Check if the employee will handle payment transactions (Registers, Tech, Supervisor, etc.) Last PCI Title Date and Time No Auto-updated column that is no longer in use. Will be deactivated in 2026. Employee Status Title Choice Yes Active, Inactive, On Leave Other than On Leave, please change status following instructions from How to Use section. PCI Valid Title Calculated No Auto-updated column that is no longer in use. Will be deactivated in 2026. Supervisor Title Person or Group Yes Employee Supervisor's Microsoft Profile. MS Teams MS Teams Choice No The Cornell Store, CRS Print Services, CRS Commons & Statler, CRS Warehouse Team associated with this employee record. If the employee is not associated with any existing MS Teams, please leave empty. You may add more Teams; however, ensure Automation (see automation section) is updated as well. Listserv Title Choice Yes Employee Supervisor's Microsoft Profile.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
A Note About the Staff Availability System

This system is primarily composed of a SharePoint list named Staff Availability. However, the details in this section show the entire system (which includes the use of the Employee Records System and a SharePoint Site).

The Staff Availability Tool is our in-house system for collecting and managing employee availability throughout the semester. Because our store operates in a university setting, we often see frequent changes in staff schedules, especially with student employees. This tool is designed to work seamlessly with our Microsoft ecosystem to make the availability process easier for both staff and supervisors.

Using this system helps us:

  • Collect staff availabilities quickly and consistently each semester (or for any period of time).
  • Let supervisors easily review, accept, return, or edit submissions.
  • Automate notifications, tracking, and updates to the Employee Records System.

  • For Supervisors

    Availability Portal

  • For All Staff

    Availability Form

docs.title: Requesting Availabilities
docs.text:
Need to send staff a form to fill out their availability? Read below!

Requirements:

All of the following requirements must be met to request avalability:

  • The employee is in the Employee Records System.
  • The employee is not already in the Availability database.

docs.title: For a limited time window:
docs.text:
This section to share with students before start of semester.

Ideal for collecting responses within a specific timeframe. For example, when students are returning to campus and you need their submissions by a set deadline.

  1. Open the Staff Availability Database
  2. Go to forms (top menu bar).
  3. Open the Availability form.
  4. On the right side, Customize > Settings > Accept Responses
  5. Enter the submission window using the Start Date and End Date. Changes get saved automatically.
  6. Go to Send form.
  7. Copy the link and share it with others.

docs.title: For anytime submissions:
docs.text:
Ideal for collecting responses within any timeframe.

  1. Send Availability Form1 to the employee.

docs.title: View, Return, Edit, Confirm, or Delete Availabilities
Viewing A Submitted Availability
docs.text:
1. Navigate to the Availability Portal.
  2. Find the employee under the Active Availabilities list.
  3. Scroll sideaways across the table to find any specific detail from the employee.
Can't find the employee?

This means they do not have a current submission of an availability.

docs.title: Returning A Submitted Availability
docs.text:
Returning an availability deactivates their current submission and sends them a new Availability form (1).

  1. It sends them the Anytime submissions form.

If you return a submission, we highly recommend you speak to the employee beforehand to provide some additional context. If the changes are minor, consider modifying the submission yourself. Returning a submission will delete the current record.

Steps to return:

  1. Navigate to the Availability Portal.
  2. Find the employee under the Active Availabilities list.
  3. Click on the blue, left-pointing arrow next to their name.
  4. Done
What happens next?
  • The Employee Status and Supervisor Status columns change to Draft and Inactive.
  • The employee receives an email (you will be cc'd in it) requesting that the employee go resubmit their availability. (1)
    • The employee will be given the details of the previous submission to make resubmission easier.
  1. The employee will receive a link to resubmit their availability (this form does not have an expiration date set).

A few more things:

When should I return an submission?

It varies. If the employee asks to make major adustments to their schedule or if you are unhappy with the current submission. Returning it to the employee will change the record's status to "Returned," and the Employee Status to Draft mode.

Note about returning submissions:

When you return a submission, the employee receives a personalized link to update their availability. This link remains active even after the original submission window has closed, as long as their record is still in the system. This means they can continue making changes unless you manually restrict access.

For instance: 1. You return a submission to Jane Doe. 1. Jane Doe receives an email and makes changes. 1. You confirm the changes.

Jane can still go in to her personalized link afterwards and make more changes.

The only way around this is for the supervisor to modify the details themselves, or to delete the employee and resend the request for availability.

docs.title: Confirming A Submitted/Returned Availability
docs.text:
Once an employee has successfully submitted a new or returned form, a yellow dot will appear next to their submission. This indicates that the submission is new and has not been reviewed by a supervisor yet.

Steps to confirm:

  1. Navigate to the Availability Portal.
  2. Find the employee under the Active Availabilities list.
  3. Click on the yellow, dot next to their name.
  4. Done

Don't see the button? This means the employee has had their availability confirmed already.

What happens next?
  • The Supervisor Status column changes to Active.
  • The employee receives an email (you will be cc'd in it) confirming that the employee's were successfully received.

A few more things:

Need to return the submission again?

For whatever reason it may be, you may need to request the employee go back again and make changes. You can return a submission by simply clicking on the blue, left arrow. Find our more here.

docs.title: Modifying An Availability
docs.text:
There may be times when returning the entire submission isn't really necessary. Or that you can and want to make the small changes yourself without having to bother the employee with email notifications.

Steps to modify:

  1. Navigate to the Availability Portal.
  2. Find the employee under the Active Availabilities list.
  3. Click on the gray, pencil next to their name.
  4. This will open the form as a pop-up. Make any changes you'd like.

A few more things:

When should I modify instead of returning an submission?

It depends. If the employee mentions a small mistake directly to you, or if you notice a minor typo or incorrect detail, it may be easier to make the change yourself. Ultimately, it’s up to your discretion.

However, avoid modifying an employee’s availability without their consent or knowledge — they won’t receive a notification when changes are made on their behalf.

docs.title: Removing Availability(ies)
docs.text:
There may be times when you need to individually remove an employee's availability or multiple availabilities at once.

Steps to delete:

  1. Navigate to the Availability Portal.
  2. Find the employee under the Active Availabilities list.
  3. Click on the red trash icon next to their name.
  4. This will delete the submission.
I clicked it but the submission is still there...

This is normal. It might take a couple minutes to disappear. As long as the red trash icon has disappeared, the submission will be deleted.

Is clicking the delete button the same as removing an availability?

No! If you see a button that says "Delete" please do not press it. It does delete their record, but it does not update the Employee Records System to change Availability details of the employee (including the Availability Submitted button, which will then affect the view of Missing Availabilities).

A few more things:

Is there a way to mass remove all availabilities?

Unfortunatel, there is not. You will have to click each entry.

However, avoid modifying an employee’s availability without their consent or knowledge — they won’t receive a notification when changes are made on their behalf.

docs.title: Missing Availabilities (View and/or Request)
docs.text:
Are you missing someone's availability and don't see it in the spreadsheet? Now you can keep track of missing availabilities too.

Requirements:

All of the following requirements must be met to view/request missing avalability:

  • The employee has to be in the Employee Records System.
  • In the ERS, Availability Submitted is marked as No.

Steps to view who is missing availability:

  1. Navigate to the Availability Portal.
  2. Find the employee under the Missing Availabilities list.

Reminding availability submission: If you want to send a friendly nudge to fill out their availability, you can click on the bell icon (1).

  1. Please note, you can only send one per day.
I don't see the employee in the Missing list, and their submission is not in Active...

The Missing list is filtered to show employees who meet all the following conditions in the Employee Records System:

  • Availability Submitted No
  • Employee Status Active
  • Department is not empty.

If you do not see an employee, it is because one or more of these conditions is not being met.

I see an employee both in Active and Missing, which one is true?

If they are in both, the Active list is true. There must have been a glitch in the automation that changes employee's Availability Submitted column to No. Please report this.

However, avoid modifying an employee’s availability without their consent or knowledge — they won’t receive a notification when changes are made on their behalf.

There are employees in here that I won't need availability from ever. How do I remove them?

You'll need to check them off manually from the Employee Records System. Contact the manager of the Employee Records System and ask them to check off the Availability Submitted field.

docs.title: Submitting Availability
docs.text:
To submit your availability, you must have received an Availability form. (1)

  1. Don't have the form? Please ask a supervisor for the availability form. If they are unsure, redirect them to this site for information.

Filling out the form:

  1. Employee: Start with your name. If you do not see your name in this list, it means you have not been added to our Employee Records System. Please contact your supervisor. If you get a duplicate error message, it means you already have an entry in our database. Please let your supervisor know you'd like to remove your entry.
  2. Effective Date: Enter the earliest date when this availability can start.
  3. Day Availability: For each day, enter your availability.
  4. Comments: Enter any comments regarding your availability in the box.
  5. Click Submit

You will then receive an email confirmation with a copy of your submission details.

docs.title: Modifying/Deleting an Existing Availability
docs.text:
Did your availability change? Did you make a mistake on the submission?

If your availability completely changed:

  1. Reach out to your supervisor and ask them to return your entry.

    If they are unsure how to, redirect them to this site for information.

  2. Once this occurs, you will receive an email prompting you to fill out your availability.

  3. Fill out your new availability

If your availability slightly changed: (1)

  1. Sometimes it is easier for them to make the adjustments without redoing the entire process.

Steps:

  1. Reach out to your supervisor and ask them to modify your entry.

    If they are unsure how to, redirect them to this site for information.

  2. Provide the details to modify.

  3. Check for confirmation from your supervisor that the details have been updated.

The submission confirmation email can help make changes easier:

In the email, there is a Make changes to my availability and Cancel my availability links. Clicking them creates a pre-drafted email to your supervisor. Add your specific changes and send!

docs.title: Notification Emails
docs.text:
Using this system may send notification emails to particular employees or the system inbox.

Availability Submitted

Email Preview

This email gets sent if any of the following conditions are met:

  • Employee submits an availability using the form.

More information:

  • It is sent to the employee only. (1)
  • It is sent from the SCL-CBS-YODECK-EMP email disguised as custorestaff@cornell.edu.

Availability Received Email Preview

  1. Even if it is filled out by someone else, it is sent to the staff member in the submission.
Code

If you need help modifying or adding more details to this template, please copy and paste it into an AI tool like ChatGPT and ask for modifications to be made.

Availability-Received.html
<meta>
<title>Availability Confirmation</title>
<style>
  body {
    font-family: Arial, sans-serif;
    background-color: #F7F7F7;
    margin: 0;
    padding: 0;
  }
  .container {
    max-width: 600px;
    margin: 20px auto;
    background: #ffffff;
    padding: 20px;
    border-radius: 8px;
    box-shadow: 0 2px 5px rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
  }
  .header {
    background-color: #B31B1B;
    color: #ffffff;
    text-align: center;
    padding: 15px;
    border-radius: 8px 8px 0 0;
    font-size: 20px;
  }
  .content {
    padding: 20px;
    color: #333333;
    font-size: 15px;
  }
  .ticket-info {
    background-color: #f9f9f9;
    padding: 15px;
    border-left: 4px solid #222222;
    margin: 20px 0;
    border-radius: 5px;
  }
  .footer {
    text-align: center;
    font-size: 12px;
    color: #888888;
    padding: 10px;
    margin-top: 20px;
  }
  ul {
    padding-left: 20px;
  }
  li {
    margin-bottom: 10px;
  }
</style>



<div class="container">
  <div class="header">
    Availability Received
  </div>
  <div class="content">
    <p>Hello @{first(split(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/Staff/Value'], ' '))},</p>

    <p>We’ve received your availability submission. Below is a summary for your records:</p>
    <p><strong>Submission ID:</strong> @{outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/ID']}</p>

    <div class="ticket-info">
      <p><strong>Effective Date:</strong> @{formatDateTime(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/Effective'], 'dddd, MMMM dd, yyyy')}</p>
      <hr>
      <p><strong>Monday:</strong> @{if(empty(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/MondayAvailability']), 'Not Available', outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/MondayAvailability'])}</p>
      <p><strong>Tuesday:</strong> @{if(empty(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/TuesdayAvailability']), 'Not Available', outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/TuesdayAvailability'])}</p>
      <p><strong>Wednesday:</strong> @{if(empty(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/WednesdayAvailability']), 'Not Available', outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/WednesdayAvailability'])}</p>
      <p><strong>Thursday:</strong> @{if(empty(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/ThursdayAvailability']), 'Not Available', outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/ThursdayAvailability'])}</p>
      <p><strong>Friday:</strong> @{if(empty(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/FridayAvailability']), 'Not Available', outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/FridayAvailability'])}</p>
      <p><strong>Saturday:</strong> @{if(empty(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/SaturdayAvailability']), 'Not Available', outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/SaturdayAvailability'])}</p>
      <hr>
      <p><strong>Comments:</strong> 
@{outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/Comments']}</p>
    </div>

    <p>If you'd like to request changes or cancel your availability, you can use one of the following options:</p>
    <ul>
      <li>
        <a href="mailto:@{outputs('Get_the_Employee_Record')?['body/Supervisor/Email']}?subject=  [ID: @{outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/ID']}] Availability Change Request&body=Hi @{first(split(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Record')?['body/Supervisor/DisplayName'], ' '))},%0D%0A%0D%0AI’d like to request the following changes to my availability:%0D%0A%0D%0AMonday:%0D%0ATuesday:%0D%0AWednesday:%0D%0AThursday:%0D%0AFriday:%0D%0ASaturday:%0D%0A%0D%0AThank you.">
          Request Changes to Availability
        </a>
      </li>
      <li>
        <a href="mailto:@{outputs('Get_the_Employee_Record')?['body/Supervisor/Email']}?subject=  [ID: @{outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/ID']}] Availability Cancellation Request&body=Hi @{first(split(outputs('Get_the_Employee_Record')?['body/Supervisor/DisplayName'], ' '))},%0D%0A%0D%0AI need to cancel my availability submission (ID: @{outputs('Get_the_Employee_Availability')?['body/ID']}).%0D%0A%0D%0AThank you.">
          Cancel Availability Submission
        </a>
      </li>
    </ul>

    <p>If you did not submit this or have any questions, please reach out to your supervisor. Reply-to is set to your supervisor.</p>
  </div>
  <div class="footer">
    Cornell University | Cornell Retail Services System
  </div>
</div>

Availability Returned/Confirmed

Email Preview

This email gets sent if any of the following conditions are met:

  • Employee has an availability as Ready to Review
  • The supervisor has either: a. Returned the availability b. Confirmed an availability

More information:

  • It is sent to the employee, the supervisor, and whoever returned/confirmed (if different from supervisor).
  • It is sent from the SCL-CBS-YODECK-EMP email disguised as custorestaff@cornell.edu.

docs.title: Groups
docs.text:
Depending on the Status of the Employee, Listserv selected, and Advanced SharePoint Access check, they will be added/removed from the following groups:

Group Status Listserv Advanced SharePoint Access Adds to Full-time Active Full-time Part-time Active Part-time Student Active Student Advanced SharePoint Active Yes Removes from Full-time Inactive Full-time Part-time Inactive Part-time Student Inactive Student Advanced SharePoint Inactive No Note: blank columns mean that the value in the column is irrelevant.

docs.title: Other Effects
docs.text:
Staff Availability

Whenever staff create new availability for themselves, they look up their name using a dropdown. The dropdown values are pulled directly from the Employee Record System. Therefore, if the employee is not registered in the ERS, they will not be able to add their availability.

Radio Assignments

Whenever radios get assigned to staff, the Radio Database uses an Employee Name dropdown to link the employee to the radio. The dropdown values from Employee Name are pulled directly from the Employee Record System. Therefore, if the employee is not registered in the ERS, they will not be found when assigning a radio.

docs.title: Advanced
docs.text:
The information presented below relates to the Staff Availability List only.

The information in this section can be accessed or modified from the List Settings, available below.

View List Settings

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text:
This list does not follow the parent permissions of the SharePoint Site. I.e., this list has unique permissions.

Permissions User(s)/Group(s) Comment Restricted hello____ hello____ Read hello____ hello____ Contribute hello____ hello____ Edit hello____ hello____ Design hello____ hello____ Full Control hello____ hello____

docs.title: Views
docs.text:
In SharePoint Lists, views are customized ways of displaying list data — they let you filter, sort, or group items to focus on specific information. Each view can show different columns, layouts, or criteria depending on the user’s needs.

Below is a list of all current views in the Employee Records System.

View Purpose Access JSON Comments Administrative View Gives the user unfilter and unsorted access to all records in the database as well as all columns. View No Availability View Gives the user a department-grouped view of Active Employees to see their Last & Return Days, as well as direct access to their availability. View No This view is specifically useful for the Staff Availability System. All Employees Gives the user a list of all currently active employees in Cornell Retail Services. View No Inactive Gives the user a list of all inactive employees in Cornell Retail Services. View No Only inactive employees that have been placed inactive in the last 6 months (they get deleted afterwards).

Want to Create Your Own View?

Lists also lets you create your own view that can be easily accessible by other viewers of the list. You can customize the columns, placement, even the design of it (like how Announcements goes from spreadsheet to banners!).

View more here.

docs.title: Column Details
docs.text:
Note:

The Required column described below is different than what the list settings will show on SharePoint. This is intentional to provide the reader of this document better guidance on using the system.

Name Internal Name Type Required Description Comments Staff Staff Lookup Yes The employee linked from the main employee directory. Looks up from the Employee Records System. Staff: Graduation Year Staff_x003a__x0020_Graduation_x0 Lookup No Linked from the Employee Records System Pulls Automatically from Staff Employee Record. Staff: Department Assigned Staff_x003a_DepartmentValue Lookup No Linked from the Employee Records System Pulls Automatically from Staff Employee Record. Staff: Last Day Staff_x003a__x0020_Last_x0020_Da Lookup No Linked from the Employee Records System Mostly applicable to student employees leaving each semester. Effective Date Effective Date Yes The first date the availability goes into effect. Monday Availability MondayAvailability Date and Time No Availability for Monday. Format: e.g., 8:00 am – 2:30 pm. Tuesday Availability TuesdayAvailability Text No Availability for Tuesday. Same format as above. Wednesday Availability WednesdayAvailability Text No Availability for Wednesday. Thursday Availability ThursdayAvailability Text No Availability for Thursday. Friday Availability FridayAvailability Text No Availability for Friday. Saturday Availability SaturdayAvailability Text No Availability for Saturday. Actions Actions Single line of text No Received, Confirmed, Returned, Delete (Used for automations to direct action). Also contains JSON with specific buttons like Confirming, Returning, Deleting, or Modifying an Availability. Employee Status EmployeeStatus Single line of text Yes Draft, Ready to Review Changed when Actions buttons are clicked (see video). Supervisor Status SupervisorStatus Single line of text Yes Active, Pending, Returned, Inactive Changed when Actions buttons are clicked (see video). Employee Author Person or Group Yes Whoever created the entry. Read-only. Created Created Date and Time Yes Date when entry was created. Read-only. Modified By Editor Person or Group Yes Whoever last modified the entry. Read-only. Modified Modified Date and Time Yes Date when entry was last modified. Read-only.
